<A NAME="page_fq48501_1_38"> </A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>GUESS?,&nbsp;INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B> NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued) </B></FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>(17) Stock-Based Compensation (Continued) </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
fair value of stock options used to compute the pro-forma net earnings and earnings per common share disclosures above for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005 is the
estimated value at the grant date using the Black-Scholes option-pricing model. The following weighted-average assumptions were used for the valuation of the grants in 2005: risk-free
interest rates of 4.05%; expected volatility of 57%; no expected dividend yield; and a weighted-average expected life of 5&nbsp;years. The risk-free interest rate was based on the U.S.
Treasury yield curve in effect for the expected term of the option at the time of grant. The expected volatility was determined based on an average of the historical volatility for the expected term.
The dividend yield and expected life were based on historical data. Using the Black-Scholes option-pricing model, the weighted-average fair value of each option granted during 2005 was $4.84. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
following table summarizes the stock compensation expense under all of the Company's stock plans during the fiscal years ended February&nbsp;2, 2008 and December&nbsp;31, 2006
and the one-month period ended February&nbsp;3, 2007 (in thousands): </FONT></P>

<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=92,EFW="2183334",CP="GUESS ?, INC.",DN="1",CHK=3658,FOLIO='F-38',FILE='DISK108:[08ZAF1.08ZAF48501]FQ48501A.;14',USER='TOSBORNA',CD=';1-APR-2008;14:57' -->
<A NAME="page_fq48501_1_39"> </A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>GUESS?,&nbsp;INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES </B></FONT></P>

<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=2 ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:times;"><HR NOSHADE SIZE=4></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
fair value of each stock option was estimated on the grant date using the Black-Scholes option-pricing model with the following weighted-average assumptions used for grants during
the one-month period ended February&nbsp;3, 2007: a risk-free interest rate of 4.60%, no expected dividend yield, an expected volatility of 49.6%, an expected forfeiture rate
of 17.97%, and an expected life of 6.25&nbsp;years. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
fair value of each stock option was estimated on the grant date using the Black-Scholes option-pricing model with the following weighted-average assumptions used for grants during
the year ended February&nbsp;2, 2008: a risk-free interest rate of 4.63%, an expected dividend yield of 0.60%, an expected volatility of 46.2%, an expected forfeiture rate of 15.05%, and
an expected life of 6.25&nbsp;years. For options grants from November 2007 onwards, an expected life of 3.7&nbsp;years was used. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
weighted-average grant-date fair value of options granted was $17.57 during the one-month period ended February&nbsp;3, 2007. There were no stock options
exercised during the month ended February&nbsp;3, 2007. The compensation expense recognized was $0.6&nbsp;million before the recognized income tax benefit of $0.2&nbsp;million during the
one-month period ended February&nbsp;3, 2007. As of February&nbsp;3, 2007, there was approximately $10.0&nbsp;million of unrecognized compensation cost, net of estimated forfeitures,
related to nonvested stock options. This cost is expected to be recognized over a weighted-average period of 1.4&nbsp;years. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>F-39</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>GUESS?,&nbsp;INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B> NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued) </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>(17) Stock-Based Compensation (Continued) </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
weighted-average grant-date fair value of options granted was $19.96 and $11.92 during the year ended February&nbsp;2, 2008 and December&nbsp;31, 2006, respectively.
The total intrinsic value of stock options exercised during the years ended February&nbsp;2, 2008, December&nbsp;31, 2006 and December&nbsp;31, 2005 was $31.7&nbsp;million,
$31.0&nbsp;million and $12.3&nbsp;million, respectively. The intrinsic value of stock options is defined as the difference between the Company's stock price on the exercise date and the
grant-date exercise price. The total cash received from option exercises was $6.7&nbsp;million, $11.0&nbsp;million and $6.3&nbsp;million during the years ended February&nbsp;2,
2008, December&nbsp;31, 2006 and December&nbsp;31, 2005, respectively. The excess tax benefit realized for the tax deductions from these option exercises for fiscal 2008 was $9.9&nbsp;million
and is included in cash flows from financing activities for the year ended February&nbsp;2, 2008. The compensation expense recognized was $5.6&nbsp;million before the recognized income tax benefit
of $2.3&nbsp;million during the year ended February&nbsp;2, 2008. As of February&nbsp;2, 2008, there was approximately $9.3&nbsp;million of unrecognized compensation cost, net of estimated
forfeitures, related to nonvested stock options. This cost is expected to be recognized over a weighted-average period of 1.2&nbsp;years. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>compensation
cost, net of estimated forfeitures, related to nonvested stock awards/units. This cost is expected to be recognized over a weighted-average period of 3.8&nbsp;years. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
weighted-average grant-date fair value of nonvested stock awards/units granted during the fiscal year ended February&nbsp;2, 2008 was $44.55. The total fair value at
grant date of previously nonvested stock awards/units that were vested during fiscal 2008, 2006 and 2005 was $6.0&nbsp;million, $1.0&nbsp;million and $0.8&nbsp;million, respectively. During
fiscal 2008, 2006 and 2005, the total intrinsic value of nonvested stock awards/units that vested was $11.9&nbsp;million, $2.9&nbsp;million and $1.5&nbsp;million, respectively. The excess tax
benefit realized for the tax deductions from these vested shares for fiscal 2008 was $2.2&nbsp;million and has been included in cash flows from financing activities for the year ended
February&nbsp;2, 2008. The excess tax shortfall of $0.1&nbsp;million was included in cash flows from operating activities for the year ended February&nbsp;2, 2008. The total intrinsic value of
nonvested stock awards/units outstanding and unvested at February&nbsp;2, 2008 was $64.7&nbsp;million. The compensation expense included in SG&amp;A recognized during fiscal 2008 was
$13.3&nbsp;million, before the recognized income tax benefit of $5.3&nbsp;million. As of February&nbsp;2, 2008, there was approximately $46.5&nbsp;million of total unrecognized compensation
cost, net of estimated forfeitures, related to nonvested stock awards/units. This cost is expected to be recognized over a weighted-average period of 2.2&nbsp;years. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>ESPP  </I></B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In January 2002, the Company established an ESPP, the terms of which allow for qualified employees (as defined) to participate in the purchase of designated
shares of the Company's common stock at a price equal to 85% of the lower of the closing price at the beginning or end of each quarterly stock purchase period. The ESPP is a straight purchase plan and
is not subject to any holding period, however all Company employees are subject to the terms of the Company's securities trading policy which generally prohibits the purchase or sale of any Company
securities during the two weeks before the end of each fiscal quarter through two days after the public announcement by the Company of its earnings for that period. On January&nbsp;23, 2002, the
Company filed with the SEC a Registration Statement on Form&nbsp;S-8 registering 4,000,000 shares of common stock for the ESPP. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
the fiscal years ended February&nbsp;2, 2008, December&nbsp;31, 2006, and December&nbsp;31, 2005, 54,243, 54,846 and 73,288 shares of the Company's common stock were issued
pursuant to the ESPP at an average price of $33.18, $16.55 and $7.17 per share, respectively. </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
fair value of stock compensation expense associated with our ESPP was estimated on the date of grant using the Black-Scholes option-pricing valuation model and the following
weighted-average assumptions for grants during fiscal years 2008, 2006 and 2005 and one-month period ended February&nbsp;3, 2007. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>F-41</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=95,EFW="2183334",CP="GUESS ?, INC.",DN="1",CHK=578266,FOLIO='F-41',FILE='DISK108:[08ZAF1.08ZAF48501]FQ48501A.;14',USER='TOSBORNA',CD=';1-APR-2008;14:57' -->
<A NAME="page_fq48501_1_42"> </A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>GUESS?,&nbsp;INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B> NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued) </B></FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>(17) Stock-Based Compensation (Continued) </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
weighted-average grant-date fair value of ESPP options granted during the one-month period ended February&nbsp;3, 2007 was $7.15. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
weighted-average grant-date fair value of ESPP options granted during fiscal 2008, 2006 and 2005 was $11.44, $7.15 and $4.86, respectively. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>(18) Share Repurchase Program  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In March 2008, the Company's Board of Directors terminated the previously authorized 2001 share repurchase program and authorized a new program to repurchase,
from time-to-time and as market and business conditions warrant, up to $200&nbsp;million of the Company's common stock. Repurchases may be made on the open market or in
privately negotiated transactions, pursuant to Rule&nbsp;10b5-1 trading plans or other available means. There is no minimum or maximum number of shares to be repurchased under the
program and the program may be discontinued at any time, without prior notice. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>(19) Acquisition of Focus Europe&nbsp;S.r.l. ("Focus")  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective December&nbsp;31, 2006, Guess?,&nbsp;Inc., through its wholly-owned subsidiary, GUESS? Europe,&nbsp;B.V. ("Purchaser"), completed the acquisition
of 75% of the equity interest of Focus Europe&nbsp;S.r.l. ("Focus") from Focus Pull&nbsp;S.p.A. ("Seller"). The Focus agreement also provided for the acquisition of 75% of the equity interest of
Focus Spain&nbsp;S.A. ("Focus Spain"). </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Since
1997, the Company has licensed to Focus the right to manufacture, distribute and retail "GUESS by MARCIANO" contemporary apparel for women and men in Europe, the Middle East and
Asia. The acquisition of the licensee is expected to further accelerate the Company's expansion in Europe. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
combined Focus and Focus Spain purchase price was finalized in October 2007 in the amount of &euro;19.4&nbsp;million ($25.6&nbsp;million) after resolving certain
purchase price adjustments and other contingencies with the Seller. The assets included in the Focus entity acquired at closing comprised inventories not older than one year, certain long term assets
used to operate the business including leasehold interests related to four GUESS by MARCIANO stores and approximately &euro;1.1&nbsp;million ($1.5&nbsp;million) in cash to pay for
certain acquired obligations. These obligations, that included certain royalties payable to the Company under the pre-existing license agreement and certain amounts due under a loan
agreement, were explicitly limited to the &euro;1.1&nbsp;million ($1.5&nbsp;million) cash acquired. The Purchaser did not assume any trade receivables, other payables or other debt as
part of the Focus acquisition. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At
closing, the Purchaser paid approximately &euro;10.0&nbsp;million ($13.2&nbsp;million) in cash and the Company issued &euro;2.0&nbsp;million
($2.6&nbsp;million) in Guess?,&nbsp;Inc. common stock based on the stock price at the closing date. After resolving the purchase price contingencies, final payments totaling
&euro;7.4&nbsp;million ($9.8&nbsp;million) were made to the Seller. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
agreement also provides that at specific times during 2008, 2009 and 2010, the Seller may require the Purchaser to acquire the remaining 25% of equity interests in Focus and Focus
Spain for cash based upon a multiple of their combined net income for the immediately preceding fiscal year. The agreement further provides that, at a specific time in 2011, the Purchaser will have
the option to purchase the remaining 25% of equity interest in Focus and Focus Spain for cash based upon a multiple of their consolidated net income for the immediately preceding fiscal year. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>F-42</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
$8.7&nbsp;million of acquired intangible assets primarily represents the acquisition value of the pre-existing Focus license arrangement and lease acquisition costs,
both of which are subject to amortization. The intangible assets acquired from Focus have a weighted-average useful life of approximately four years. The remaining annual amortization expense for the
Focus acquired intangible assets is estimated to be approximately $2.2&nbsp;million each year for fiscal 2009 through fiscal 2011 and is recorded as an expense in the European operations segment.
Goodwill associated with this acquisition is recorded in the European operations segment and is non-deductible for tax purposes. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>(20) Foreign Currency Derivative Financial Instruments  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company operates in foreign countries, which exposes it to market risk associated with foreign currency exchange rate fluctuations. The Company has entered
into certain forward contracts and swaps to hedge the risk of foreign currency rate fluctuations. The Company has elected to apply the hedge accounting rules as required by SFAS&nbsp;133 for certain
of these hedges. The Company's objective is to hedge the variability in forecasted cash flow due to the foreign currency risk (USD/Canadian exchange rate) associated with certain anticipated inventory
purchases on a first dollar basis for specific months. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
the year ended February&nbsp;2, 2008, the Company purchased U.S. dollar forward contracts in Canada totaling US$52.0&nbsp;million to hedge forecasted merchandise purchases
that were designated as cash-flow hedges. As of February&nbsp;2, 2008, approximately US$27.0&nbsp;million were outstanding and are expected to mature over the next eleven months. Our
derivative financial instruments are recorded on the consolidated balance sheet at fair value based on quoted market rates. These forward contracts are used to hedge forecasted merchandise purchases
over specific months. Changes in the fair value of forward contracts designated as cash-flow hedges are recorded as a component of accumulated other comprehensive earnings within
stockholders' equity, and are recognized in cost of goods sold in the period which approximates the time the hedged merchandise inventory is sold. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An
unrealized loss of approximately US$1.5&nbsp;million, net of tax, primarily relating to contracts that have already matured, has been recorded in accumulated other comprehensive
income at February&nbsp;2, 2008 and will be recognized as a charge to cost of goods sold on a pre-tax basis over the next five months. At February&nbsp;2, 2008, the unrealized gain of
the remaining open forward contracts recorded on the balance sheet was approximately US$0.1&nbsp;million. The ineffectiveness was immaterial during the year ended February&nbsp;2, 2008 and it was
recorded to earnings. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>F-43</FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Also,
the Company has foreign currency contracts that are not designated as hedges for accounting purposes. Changes in fair value of foreign currency contracts not qualifying as cash
flow hedges are reported in net earnings as part of other income and expense. For the year ended February&nbsp;2, 2008, the Company recorded losses for the Canadian and Euro foreign currency
contracts of US$1.9&nbsp;million and US$5.5&nbsp;million, respectively, which have been included in other income and expense. At February&nbsp;2, 2008, the Company had Canadian dollar foreign
currency contracts to purchase US$26.0&nbsp;million, expected to mature over the next eleven months and Euro foreign currency contracts to purchase US$87.6&nbsp;million, expected to mature over
the next nine months. At February&nbsp;3, 2007, the Company had Canadian dollar foreign currency contracts to purchase US$2.0&nbsp;million and Euro foreign currency contracts to purchase
US$43.0&nbsp;million. Net unrealized losses on these Canadian and Euro forward contracts were $3.3&nbsp;million (primarily related to our Euro forward contracts), $1.4&nbsp;million,
$0.1&nbsp;million and $0.4&nbsp;million for the fiscal years ended February&nbsp;2, 2008, December&nbsp;31, 2006 and December&nbsp;31, 2005 and the one-month period ended
February&nbsp;3, 2007, respectively, and were recorded in current liabilities on the consolidated balance sheet. </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>(21) Acquisition of BARN&nbsp;S.r.l. ("BARN")  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective January&nbsp;16, 2008, the Company, through a subsidiary, acquired 100% of the capital stock of BARN for a purchase price of approximately
&euro;5.0&nbsp;million ($7.4&nbsp;million), subject to certain purchase price adjustments which are expected to be finalized as part of the pending audit of the acquired balance sheet. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
2003, the Company licensed to BARN the right to manufacture and distribute children's clothing in certain territories of Europe for a term of three years. The license agreement was
amended as of June&nbsp;19, 2006 to, among other things, extend the term until December&nbsp;31, 2009. The acquisition of the licensee increases the assortment of apparel products under direct
management of the Company and is expected to add to the Company's expansion plans in Europe. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
assets and liabilities included in the acquired entity at closing comprised inventory, trade receivables, payables, debt and certain long term assets used to operate the business
including leasehold interests related to four GUESS KIDS stores. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>F-44</FONT></P>

</TABLE></DIV>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
$5.0&nbsp;million of acquired intangible assets primarily represents the acquisition value of the pre-existing BARN license arrangement and lease acquisition costs,
both of which are subject to amortization. The license reacquired from BARN has a weighted-average useful life of approximately 2.3&nbsp;years. The license, which represents the largest intangible
asset class, has a useful life of two years. The total annual amortization of all intangible assets (excluding goodwill) over the next two years is approximately $2.7&nbsp;million and
$1.7&nbsp;million for fiscal 2009 and 2010, respectively. Goodwill associated with this acquisition is recorded in the European operations segment and is non-deductible for tax purposes. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>(22) Subsequent Events  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On March&nbsp;19, 2008, the Company announced a regular quarterly cash dividend of $0.08 per share on the Company's common stock. The dividend will be payable
on April&nbsp;18, 2008 to shareholders of record at the close of business on April&nbsp;2, 2008. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>F-45</FONT></P>

<A NAME="toc_ka48502_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit 10.2    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ka48502_first_amendment_to_the_guess_,__fir02210"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ka48502_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>FIRST AMENDMENT TO THE<BR>  GUESS?,&nbsp;INC.<BR>  1996 EQUITY INCENTIVE PLAN    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, Guess?,&nbsp;Inc. (the "Company") maintains the Guess?,&nbsp;Inc. 1996 Equity Incentive Plan (the
"Plan"); </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, pursuant to Section&nbsp;17 of the Plan, the Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors of the Company may amend the Plan
at any time, subject to certain limitations; </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Plan does not clearly address the issuance of shares in book entry form or other uncertificated means and the rights, if any,
the holders of such shares may have under the Plan; and </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Company wishes to amend the Plan to permit the issuance of shares in book entry form and clarify the rights, if any, the
holders of such shares have under the Plan; </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>NOW, THEREFORE</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Plan is hereby amended, effective as of December&nbsp;17, 2007, as follows: </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>SECTION&nbsp;8  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B> STOCK OPTIONS  </B></FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Subsection&nbsp;8(g)
is amended in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></DD></DL>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Rights as Shareholder.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A Participant shall have no rights as a shareholder with respect to any shares of Common Stock
issuable upon exercise of a Stock Option until shares of Common Stock (either in certificate or book entry form) are issued to the Participant and, subject to Section&nbsp;15(b), no adjustment shall
be made for dividends or distributions or other rights in respect of any share for which the record date is prior to the date on which the Participant shall become the holder of record thereof." </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>SECTION&nbsp;9  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B> RESTRICTED STOCK AWARDS  </B></FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Subsection&nbsp;9(c)
is amended in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<UL>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Evidence of Ownership.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At the time of grant, the Company, in its discretion, shall issue to each Participant receiving a
Restricted Stock Award either: (i)&nbsp;a certificate or certificates in respect of such shares of Common Stock or (ii)&nbsp;uncertificated shares in book entry form. In either case, such shares
shall be registered in the name of such Participant, and shall bear an appropriate legend or notation, as applicable, referring to the terms, conditions and restrictions applicable to such Award. The
Committee may require that, as a condition of any Restricted Stock Award (x)&nbsp;the Participant shall have delivered a stock power, endorsed in blank, relating to the Common Stock covered by such
Award and (y)&nbsp;shares evidencing such Restricted Stock Award (if in certificate form) be held in custody by the Company until the restrictions thereon have lapsed." </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>SECTION&nbsp;10  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B> PERFORMANCE SHARE AWARDS  </B></FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Subsection&nbsp;10(e)
is amended in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<UL>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Rights as Shareholder.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as otherwise provided by the Committee in the applicable Award Agreement, a Participant shall
have no rights as a shareholder with respect to a Performance Share Award until shares of Common Stock (either in certificate or book entry form) are issued to the Participant following the conclusion
of the Performance Period, and, subject to Section&nbsp;15(b), no adjustment shall be made for dividends or distributions or other rights in respect of any share for which the record date is prior
to the date on which the Participant shall become the holder of record thereof." </FONT></P>

</UL>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2183334",CP="GUESS ?, INC.",DN="2",CHK=858781,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK112:[08ZAF2.08ZAF48502]KA48502A.;3',USER='LSMITH',CD='29-MAR-2008;13:29' -->
<A NAME="page_ka48502_1_2"> </A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>SECTION&nbsp;12  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B> STOCK APPRECIATION RIGHTS  </B></FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Subsection&nbsp;12(g)
is amended in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<UL>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Rights as Shareholder.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A Participant shall have no rights as a shareholder with respect to any Stock Appreciation Rights
unless and until shares of Common Stock (either in certificate or book entry form) are issued to the Participant as payment upon exercise of such Stock Appreciation Right, and, subject to
Section&nbsp;15(b), no adjustment shall be made for dividends or distributions or other rights in respect of any share for which the record date is prior to the date on which the Participant shall
become the holder of record thereof." </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>SECTION&nbsp;18  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B> MISCELLANEOUS  </B></FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Subsection&nbsp;18(f)
is amended in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></DD></DL>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Securities Law Restrictions.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Committee may require each Eligible Individual purchasing or acquiring shares of Common
Stock pursuant to a Stock Option or other Award under the Plan to represent to and agree with the Company in writing that such Eligible Individual is acquiring the shares for investment and not with a
view to the distribution thereof. All shares of Common Stock delivered under the Plan shall be subject to such stock-transfer orders and other restrictions as the Committee may deem advisable under
the rules, regulations, and other requirements of the Securities and Exchange Commission, the New York Stock Exchange or any other exchange upon which the Common Stock is then listed, and any
applicable federal or state securities law, and the Committee may cause a legend or legends to be put on any such shares issued in certificate form, or a notation to be made on any such shares issued
in book entry form, as applicable, to make appropriate reference to such restrictions. No shares of Common Stock shall be issued hereunder unless the Company shall have determined that such issuance
is in compliance with, or pursuant to an exemption form, all applicable federal and state securities laws." </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>[Remainder
of page intentionally left blank] </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2183334",CP="GUESS ?, INC.",DN="2",CHK=698832,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK112:[08ZAF2.08ZAF48502]KA48502A.;3',USER='LSMITH',CD='29-MAR-2008;13:29' -->
<A NAME="page_ka48502_1_3"> </A>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>IN WITNESS WHEREOF,</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> the Company has caused its duly authorized officer to execute this amendment. </FONT></P>

<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#08ZAF48501_3">QuickLinks</A></FONT>

 </FONT></P>

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kc48502_exhibit_10.6"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kc48502_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit 10.6    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kc48502_third_amendment_to_the_guess_,__thi02178"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kc48502_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>THIRD AMENDMENT TO THE<BR>  GUESS?,&nbsp;INC.<BR>  2004 EQUITY INCENTIVE PLAN    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, Guess?,&nbsp;Inc. (the "Company") maintains the Guess?,&nbsp;Inc. 2004 Equity Incentive Plan (as may
be amended, restated and/or modified from time to time, the "Plan"); </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, pursuant to Section&nbsp;18 of the Plan, the Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors of the Company may amend the Plan
at any time, subject to certain limitations; </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Plan and certain forms of agreements related thereto, including the form Restricted Stock Agreement, Restricted Stock Unit
Agreement, and Nonqualified Stock Option Agreement (collectively, the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Form Agreements</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), do not clearly address the issuance of shares in book entry
form or other uncertificated means and the rights, if any, the holders of such shares may have under the Plan; and </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Company wishes to amend the Plan and the Form Agreements to permit the issuance of shares in book entry form and clarify the
rights, if any, the holders of such shares have under the Plan; </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>NOW, THEREFORE</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Form Agreements, in substantially the forms attached hereto as </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Exhibits&nbsp;A</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>B</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> and </FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>C</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> are hereby adopted and
approved, effective as of December&nbsp;17, 2007; and </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>RESOLVED FURTHER</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Plan is hereby amended, effective as of December&nbsp;17, 2007, as follows: </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>SECTION&nbsp;8  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B> STOCK OPTIONS  </B></FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Subsection&nbsp;8(g)
is amended in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></DD></DL>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Rights as Shareholder.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A Participant shall have no rights as a shareholder with respect to any shares of Common Stock
issuable upon exercise of a Stock Option until shares of Common Stock (either in certificate or book entry form) shall have been issued to the Participant and, subject to Section&nbsp;16(b), no
adjustment shall be made for dividends or distributions or other rights in respect of any share for which the record date is prior to the date on which the Participant shall become the holder of
record thereof." </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>SECTION&nbsp;8  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B> RESTRICTED STOCK AWARDS  </B></FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Subsection&nbsp;9(c)
is amended in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<UL>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Evidence of Ownership.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At the time of grant, the Company shall, in its discretion, issue to each Participant receiving a
Restricted Stock Award either: (i)&nbsp;a certificate or certificates in respect of such shares of Common Stock or (ii)&nbsp;uncertificated shares in book entry form. In either case, such shares
shall be registered in the name of such Participant, and shall bear an appropriate legend or notation, as applicable, referring to the terms, conditions and restrictions applicable to such Award. The
Committee may require that, as a condition of any Restricted Stock Award: (x)&nbsp;the Participant shall have delivered a stock power, endorsed in blank, relating to the Common Stock covered by such
Award and (y)&nbsp;shares evidencing such Restricted Stock Award (if in certificate form) be held in custody by the Company until the restrictions thereon have lapsed." </FONT></P>

</UL>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2183334",CP="GUESS ?, INC.",DN="3",CHK=927497,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK112:[08ZAF2.08ZAF48502]KC48502A.;4',USER='LSMITH',CD='29-MAR-2008;13:29' -->
<A NAME="page_kc48502_1_2"> </A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>SECTION&nbsp;10  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B> STOCK APPRECIATION RIGHTS  </B></FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Subsection&nbsp;10(g)
is amended in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<UL>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Rights as Shareholder.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A Participant shall have no rights as a shareholder with respect to any Stock Appreciation Right
unless and until shares of Common Stock (either in certificate or book entry form) are issued to the Participant as payment upon exercise of such Stock Appreciation Right, and, subject to
Section&nbsp;16(b), no adjustment shall be made for dividends or distributions or other rights in respect of any share for which the record date is prior to the date on which the Participant shall
become the holder of record thereof." </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>SECTION&nbsp;11  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B> PERFORMANCE SHARE AWARDS  </B></FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Subsection&nbsp;11(e)
is amended in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></DD></DL>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Rights as Shareholder.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as otherwise provided by the Committee in the applicable Award Agreement, a Participant shall
have no rights as a shareholder with respect to a Performance Share Award until shares of Common Stock (either in certificate or book entry form) shall have been issued to the Participant following
the conclusion of the Performance Period, and, subject to Section&nbsp;16(b), no adjustment shall be made for dividends or distributions or other rights in respect of any share for which the record
date is prior to the date on which the Participant shall become the holder of record thereof." </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>SECTION&nbsp;19  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B> MISCELLANEOUS  </B></FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Subsection&nbsp;19(g)
is amended in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<UL>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Securities Law Restrictions.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Committee may require each Eligible Individual purchasing or acquiring shares of Common
Stock pursuant to a Stock Option or other Award under the Plan to represent to and agree with the Company in writing that such Eligible Individual is acquiring the shares for investment and not with a
view to the distribution thereof. All shares of Common Stock delivered under the Plan shall be subject to such stock-transfer orders and other restrictions as the Committee may deem advisable under
the rules, regulations, and other requirements of the Securities and Exchange Commission, the New York Stock Exchange or any other exchange upon which the Common Stock is then listed, and any
applicable federal or state securities law, and the Committee may cause a legend or legends to be put on any such shares issued in certificate form, or a notation to be made on any such shares issued
in book entry form, as applicable, to make appropriate reference to such restrictions. No Award shall be granted or shares of Common Stock shall be issued hereunder unless the Company shall have
determined that such grant or issuance is in compliance with, or pursuant to an exemption from, all applicable federal and state securities laws." </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>[Remainder
of page intentionally left blank] </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2183334",CP="GUESS ?, INC.",DN="3",CHK=357729,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK112:[08ZAF2.08ZAF48502]KC48502A.;4',USER='LSMITH',CD='29-MAR-2008;13:29' -->
<A NAME="page_kc48502_1_3"> </A>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>IN WITNESS WHEREOF</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Company has caused its duly authorized officer to execute this amendment. </FONT></P>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"font-family:times;" -->


 </FONT></P>

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kg48502_exhibit_10.8"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kg48502_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit 10.8    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kg48502_first_amendment_to_the_guess_,__fir05234"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kg48502_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>FIRST AMENDMENT TO THE<BR>  GUESS?,&nbsp;INC.<BR>  2006 NON-EMPLOYEE DIRECTORS'<BR>  STOCK GRANT AND STOCK OPTION PLAN<BR>  (As Amended and Restated Effective September&nbsp;28, 2007)    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, Guess?,&nbsp;Inc. (the "Company") maintains the Guess?,&nbsp;Inc. 2006 Non-Employee
Directors' Stock Grant and Stock Option Plan (as may be amended, restated and/or modified from time to time, the "Plan"); </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, pursuant to Section&nbsp;6 of the Plan, the Board of Directors of the Company may amend the Plan at any time, subject to
certain limitations; </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Plan and certain forms of agreements related thereto, including the Restricted Stock Agreement (the "Form Agreement"), do not
clearly address the issuance of shares in book entry form or other uncertificated means and the rights, if any, the holders of such shares may have under the Plan; and </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Company wishes to amend the Plan and the Form Agreement to permit the issuance of shares in book entry form and clarify the
rights, if any, the holders of such shares have under the Plan; </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>NOW, THEREFORE</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Form Agreement, in substantially the form attached hereto as </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Exhibit&nbsp;A</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, is hereby adopted and approved, effective as of December&nbsp;17, 2007;
and </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>RESOLVED FURTHER</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Plan is hereby amended, effective as of December&nbsp;17, 2007, as follows: </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>SECTION&nbsp;5  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B> RESTRICTED STOCK GRANTS  </B></FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Subsection&nbsp;5(c)
is amended in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<UL>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Vesting.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Each Restricted Stock Award granted under this Section&nbsp;8 shall become vested as to 100% of the total number
of shares of Common Stock subject thereto upon the first to occur of (i)&nbsp;the first anniversary of the date of grant or (ii)&nbsp;a termination of service on the Board if such Eligible
Director has completed a full term of service and he or she does not stand for re-election at the completion of such term. Promptly after the vesting date and satisfaction of all
applicable restrictions, the Company shall, as applicable, either remove the notations on any shares issued in book entry form that have met such conditions or deliver to the Participant holding the
Award (to the extent that the certificate(s) had not previously been delivered) a certificate or certificates evidencing the number of the shares of Common Stock as to which the restrictions have
lapsed. Book entries shall be made, or certificates shall be delivered, as applicable, evidencing vested shares (and any other amounts deliverable in respect thereof shall be delivered and paid) only
to the Participant or his or her personal representative, as the case may be." </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>SECTION&nbsp;9  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B> EFFECTIVE DATE AND TERM OF THE PLAN  </B></FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>The
first paragraph of Section&nbsp;9 is amended in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></DD></DL>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"The
Plan was originally approved by the Company's Board July&nbsp;30, 1996, was amended and restated effective on May&nbsp;9, 2006 and subsequently amended on July&nbsp;11, 2006,
and was amended and restated effective September&nbsp;28, 2007 and subsequently amended hereby on December&nbsp;17, 2007. Awards granted under this Plan prior to the Restatement Date shall be
governed by the provisions of the applicable prior version of this Plan. Awards granted under this Plan on or after </FONT></P>

</UL>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2183334",CP="GUESS ?, INC.",DN="4",CHK=108821,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK112:[08ZAF2.08ZAF48502]KG48502A.;3',USER='LSMITH',CD='29-MAR-2008;13:29' -->
<A NAME="page_kg48502_1_2"> </A>
<UL>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>the
Restatement Date shall be subject to the terms and conditions set forth herein and any applicable amendment hereof." </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>SECTION&nbsp;10  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B> GENERAL PROVISIONS  </B></FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Subsection&nbsp;10(a)
is amended in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<UL>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Representations by Participants.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Board may require each Participant to represent to and agree with the Company in
writing that the Participant is acquiring the shares of Common Stock without a view to distribution or other disposition thereof. Such shares may include any legend or notation, as applicable, that
the Company deems appropriate to reflect any restrictions on transfer." </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>[Remainder
of page intentionally left blank] </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2183334",CP="GUESS ?, INC.",DN="4",CHK=958254,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK112:[08ZAF2.08ZAF48502]KG48502A.;3',USER='LSMITH',CD='29-MAR-2008;13:29' -->
<A NAME="page_kg48502_1_3"> </A>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>IN WITNESS WHEREOF</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Company has caused its duly authorized officer to execute this amendment. </FONT></P>

<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 10.11
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#08ZAF48501_5">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>


<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"Black" -->




<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"font-family:times;" -->


 </FONT></P>

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kk48502_exhibit_10.11"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kk48502_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit 10.11    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kk48502_first_amendment_to_the_guess_,__fir02462"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kk48502_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>FIRST AMENDMENT TO THE<BR>  GUESS?,&nbsp;INC.<BR>  2002 EMPLOYEE STOCK PURCHASE PLAN    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, Guess?,&nbsp;Inc. (the "Company") maintains the Guess?,&nbsp;Inc. 2002 Employee Stock Purchase Plan
(the "Plan"); </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, pursuant to Section&nbsp;20 of the Plan, the Board of Directors of the Company may amend the Plan at any time, subject to
certain limitations; </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Plan does not clearly address the issuance of shares in book entry form or other uncertificated means and the rights, if any,
the holders of such shares may have under the Plan; and </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Company wishes to amend the Plan to (i)&nbsp;permit the issuance of shares in book entry form and clarify the rights, if
any, the holders of such shares have under the Plan and (ii)&nbsp;reflect certain changes previously made to the Offering Periods under the Plan by resolution of the Board of Directors of the
Company on January&nbsp;18, 2007 pursuant to Sections&nbsp;4 and 20 of the Plan; </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>NOW, THEREFORE</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Plan is hereby amended, retroactively effective as of December&nbsp;17, 2007, as follows: </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>SECTION&nbsp;2  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B> DEFINITIONS  </B></FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Section&nbsp;2(o)
is amended in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></DD></DL>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;""</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Offering Period</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall mean a period of approximately three (3)&nbsp;months, commencing on the last Monday of the second fiscal month
of each fiscal quarter of the Company and terminating on the penultimate Friday of the second fiscal month of each immediately following fiscal quarter of the Company. The duration of Offering Periods
may be changed pursuant to Section&nbsp;4 of the Plan." </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>SECTION&nbsp;2  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B> OFFERING PERIODS  </B></FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Section&nbsp;4
is amended in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<UL>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Offering Periods.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Plan shall be implemented by consecutive Offering Periods with a new Offering Period commencing on the
last Monday of the second fiscal month of each fiscal quarter of the Company and terminating on the penultimate Friday of the second fiscal month of each immediately following fiscal quarter of the
Company, or on such other date as the Board shall determine, and continuing thereafter until terminated in accordance with Section&nbsp;20 hereof. The Board shall have the power to change the
duration of the Offering Periods (not to exceed 27&nbsp;months), including the commencement dates thereof, with respect to future offerings without stockholder approval if such change is announced
at least five (5)&nbsp;days prior to the beginning of the first Offering Period to be affected thereunder." </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>SECTION&nbsp;9  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B> DELIVERY  </B></FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Section&nbsp;9
is amended in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<UL>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Delivery.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As promptly as practicable after each Exercise Date on which a purchase of shares occurs, the Company shall, in
its discretion, either: (a)&nbsp;arrange the delivery to the participant or to a record keeping service of a certificate, as appropriate, or (b)&nbsp;issue shares in book entry form to the
participant, registered in the name of such participant, in each case, representing the shares purchased upon exercise of his or her option." </FONT></P>

</UL>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2183334",CP="GUESS ?, INC.",DN="5",CHK=179266,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK112:[08ZAF2.08ZAF48502]KK48502A.;3',USER='GKIBBE',CD='31-MAR-2008;11:31' -->
<A NAME="page_kk48502_1_2"> </A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>SECTION&nbsp;24  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B> EMPLOYEES' RIGHTS  </B></FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Section&nbsp;24(c)
is amended in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></DD></DL>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"A
participant will not be entitled to any privilege of stock ownership as to any shares not actually delivered to the participant pursuant to Section&nbsp;9 and held of record by the
participant. No adjustment
will be made for dividends or other rights as a stockholder for which a record date is prior to such date of delivery." </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>[Remainder
of page intentionally left blank] </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2183334",CP="GUESS ?, INC.",DN="5",CHK=63623,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK112:[08ZAF2.08ZAF48502]KK48502A.;3',USER='GKIBBE',CD='31-MAR-2008;11:31' -->
<A NAME="page_kk48502_1_3"> </A>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>IN WITNESS WHEREOF</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Company has caused its duly authorized officer to execute this amendment. </FONT></P>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.17
<SEQUENCE>6
<FILENAME>a2183334zex-10_17.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 10.17
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#08ZAF48501_6">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>


<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"Black" -->




<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"font-family:times;" -->


 </FONT></P>

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="km48502_exhibit_10.17"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_km48502_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit 10.17    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="km48502_separation_agreement_a__km402172"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_km48502_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>SEPARATION AGREEMENT AND GENERAL RELEASE OF ALL CLAIMS    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Separation Agreement and General Release of all Claims (hereinafter "Agreement"), dated as of January&nbsp;30, 2008, is made and entered into between
GUESS?,&nbsp;INC., a Delaware corporation (hereinafter "GUESS"), and Stephen Pearson (hereinafter "EMPLOYEE"), and is made in light of the following: </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;EMPLOYEE
is employed by GUESS as the Executive Vice President/Chief Supply Chain Officer. EMPLOYEE's employment with GUESS shall terminate on February&nbsp;4, 2008 (the "Termination
Date"). The parties hereto desire to resolve all pending issues and/or claims between them, regarding the employment of EMPLOYEE, the performance of EMPLOYEE's duties as an employee of GUESS, and the
termination of EMPLOYEE's employment with GUESS. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
parties hereto acknowledge that each has denied, and continues to deny, any claims existing or asserted by the other, but that GUESS and EMPLOYEE, desire to bring matters relating to
EMPLOYEE's employment with GUESS to a conclusion. Therefore, the parties make this Agreement, and expressly recognize that the making of this Agreement does not in any way constitute an admission of
wrongdoing or liability on the part of either party. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;EMPLOYEE
represents and warrants that EMPLOYEE (a)&nbsp;has not filed any complaints, lawsuits, charges and/or other claims against GUESS, or any of the Releasees
identified in Paragraph&nbsp;4 below, with any court or government agency or entity based upon or arising out of or in any way related to EMPLOYEE's employment, the termination of EMPLOYEE's
employment, or any acts or events which occurred prior to EMPLOYEE's execution of this Agreement; (b)&nbsp;has not assigned any such action, cause of action, claim, judgment, obligation, damage or
liability or authorized any other person or entity to assert such on EMPLOYEE's behalf; and (c)&nbsp;has not at any time sustained physical or mental injury arising out of EMPLOYEE's employment, or
the termination thereof, with GUESS through the date of execution of this Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
consideration of covenants undertaken and releases given herein by EMPLOYEE, GUESS agrees to: (a)&nbsp;pay EMPLOYEE the sum of Four Hundred Sixty Five Thousand
Dollars ($465,000), less all legally required withholdings for taxes and other related obligations, which sum represents a twelve (12)&nbsp;month severance to be paid in equal installments on
regularly scheduled paydays commencing within two weeks after receipt by GUESS of this Agreement executed by EMPLOYEE, subject to the terms set forth in this paragraph&nbsp;2; and (b)&nbsp;cost
share COBRA premiums for medical and dental benefits for EMPLOYEE and maintain EMPLOYEE's participation in Exec-U-Care, both in the same amount and on the same terms and
conditions as existed on EMPLOYEE's Termination Date from February&nbsp;4, 2008 through January&nbsp;31, 2009; however, should EMPLOYEE find and begin employment, or enter into a consulting or
other compensatory arrangement prior to February&nbsp;4, 2009, at a salary equal to or greater than EMPLOYEE's salary at GUESS as of February&nbsp;4, 2008, payments under this paragraph&nbsp;2
shall be discontinued. If EMPLOYEE accepts and begins employment or enters a consulting or other compensatory arrangement prior to January&nbsp;23, 2009, at a salary lower than the above referenced
GUESS salary, GUESS will reimburse the difference in compensation from the date of such employment. </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;EMPLOYEE
acknowledges that GUESS is not obligated to provide certain of the above-referenced consideration to EMPLOYEE under its normal policies and procedures. EMPLOYEE also
acknowledges that no other monetary payments shall be made to EMPLOYEE in return for entering into this Agreement and no other monies are owed to EMPLOYEE by GUESS or by any of the Releasees
identified in Paragraph&nbsp;4 below. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
consideration of the covenants undertaken herein by GUESS, EMPLOYEE agrees: (a)&nbsp;to continue to comply with Sections&nbsp;7(b) through (e)&nbsp;of the
Employment Agreement by and between GUESS and the EMPLOYEE, dated January&nbsp;31, 2006 (the "Employment Agreement"), concerning non-solicitation of GUESS customers, suppliers and
employees through February&nbsp;4, 2009; (b)&nbsp;to </FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2183334",CP="GUESS ?, INC.",DN="6",CHK=99176,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK112:[08ZAF2.08ZAF48502]KM48502A.;5',USER='LSMITH',CD='29-MAR-2008;13:29' -->
<A NAME="page_km48502_1_2"> </A>
<BR>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>continue
to comply with the terms of GUESS's Confidentiality Agreement which is attached hereto as </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Exhibit&nbsp;A</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> and made a part hereof
("Confidentiality Agreement"); (c)&nbsp;that GUESS may enforce the confidentiality provisions of the Confidentiality Agreement in connection with EMPLOYEE's conduct as if EMPLOYEE were still an
employee of GUESS, to the extent permitted by law; (d)&nbsp;to return any and all GUESS property to GUESS forthwith; and (e)&nbsp;that EMPLOYEE will remain available for questions concerning
EMPLOYEE's position if requested by GUESS. EMPLOYEE agrees that the provisions of this paragraph are necessary and reasonable. </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;EMPLOYEE
agrees to notify GUESS's Legal Department in the event that EMPLOYEE is contacted by anyone in connection with either GUESS or any officers, directors or employees of GUESS. In
particular, EMPLOYEE acknowledges and agrees that EMPLOYEE is obligated to cooperate with GUESS and its counsel, in connection with any subpoenas, process, or any actual or potential litigation
matters related in any way to GUESS or any officers, directors, or employees of GUESS. EMPLOYEE further acknowledges and agrees that any breach of this provision will require the return of any
severance amount paid by GUESS under this Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
consideration of the covenants undertaken herein by GUESS, EMPLOYEE also hereby covenants not to sue and fully releases and discharges GUESS, all of its divisions, and
all of its parent, successor, subsidiary and affiliated companies and entities, and each of their respective divisions, officers, directors, shareholders, partners, limited partners, agents,
employees, representatives, independent contractors, payroll companies, attorneys, insurers, licensees and assigns, past and present (all of which and whom are collectively referred to as
"Releasees"), with respect to and from, any and all claims, demands, rights, liens, agreements, contracts, covenants, actions, suits, causes of action, obligations, debts, costs, expenses, attorneys'
fees, damages, judgments, orders and liabilities of whatever kind or nature in law, equity or otherwise, whether now known or unknown, suspected or unsuspected, and whether or not concealed or hidden,
which EMPLOYEE now owns or holds, or has at anytime heretofore owned or held, or may in the future hold against said Releasees, or any of them, arising out of, grounded upon, or in any way connected
with EMPLOYEE's employment relationship with GUESS, the separation from that employment, or any other transactions, occurrences, acts or omissions or any loss, damages or injury whatsoever, known or
unknown, suspected or unsuspected, resulting from any act or omission by or on the part of the Releasees, or any of them, committed or omitted prior to the date of this Agreement ("Claim or Claims").
EMPLOYEE's release of any such Claim or Claims includes, but is not limited to, any action arising out of any foreign, federal, state or local constitution, statute, ordinance, regulation, or common
law, including, but not limited to, any Claims arising under the Age Discrimination In Employment Act; Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964; the Equal Pay Act; the American with Disabilities Act;
the Family and Medical Leave Act; the Employee Retirement Income Security Act; the Worker Adjustment and Retraining Notification Act; the California Fair Employment and Housing Act; all provisions of
the California Labor Code; all provisions of the California Government Code; NLRB charges or Claims of discrimination based on "union" status; the Orders of the California Industrial Welfare
Commission regulating wages, hours and working conditions; any other foreign, federal, state or local laws, prohibiting employment discrimination or otherwise regulating employment, including but not
limited to, any Claim or Claims for discrimination, failure to prevent discrimination, failure to prevent retaliation, harassment, failure to prevent harassment, assault, battery, misrepresentation,
fraud, deceit, invasion of privacy, breach of contract, breach of collective bargaining agreement, breach of quasi-contract, breach of implied contract, an accounting, wrongful or constructive
discharge, breach of the covenant of good faith and fair dealing, libel, slander, negligent or intentional infliction of emotional distress, violation of public policy, negligent supervision,
negligent retention, negligence, or interference with business opportunity or with contracts; and any Claim or Claims for vacation pay, severance pay, bonus or similar benefit, sick leave, pension,
retirement, retirement bonus, holiday pay, life insurance, health or medical insurance, reimbursement of health or medical costs; </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided, however</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>,
that this release shall not affect any rights EMPLOYEE has been granted pursuant to this Agreement or under any option agreement </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2183334",CP="GUESS ?, INC.",DN="6",CHK=161448,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK112:[08ZAF2.08ZAF48502]KM48502A.;5',USER='LSMITH',CD='29-MAR-2008;13:29' -->
<A NAME="page_km48502_1_3"> </A>
<BR>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>or
restricted stock agreement with respect to awards scheduled to vest thereunder prior to the Termination Date. </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;EMPLOYEE
expressly acknowledges and agrees that this Agreement includes a waiver and release of all claims which EMPLOYEE has or may have under the Age Discrimination in
Employment Act of 1967, as amended, 29 U.S.C., &sect;621, et seq. ("ADEA"). The following terms and conditions apply to and are part of the waiver and release of ADEA claims under this
Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
waiver and release of claims under the ADEA contained in this Agreement does not cover rights or claims that may arise after the date on which EMPLOYEE signs this Agreement. EMPLOYEE
has been advised to consult a lawyer before signing this Agreement. EMPLOYEE is granted twenty-one (21)&nbsp;days after EMPLOYEE is presented with this Agreement to decide whether or not
to sign this Agreement. EMPLOYEE will have the right to revoke the waiver and release of claims under the ADEA within seven (7)&nbsp;days of signing this Agreement, and this Agreement shall not
become effective or enforceable until this revocation period has expired. EMPLOYEE hereby acknowledges and agrees that EMPLOYEE is knowingly and voluntarily waiving and releasing EMPLOYEE's rights and
claims only in exchange for consideration (something of value) in addition to anything of value to which EMPLOYEE is already entitled. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;EMPLOYEE
understands, acknowledges and agrees that the California Civil Code section&nbsp;1542 states as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>"A general release does not extend to claims which the creditor does not know or suspect to exist in his favor at the time of executing the release, which if
known by him must have materially affected his settlement with the debtor."</B></FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>EMPLOYEE
hereby expressly waives the benefit of the foregoing statute. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Should
any part, term or provision of this Agreement, with the exception of the releases embodied in Paragraphs&nbsp;4, 5 and 6, be declared or determined by any Court
or other tribunal of appropriate jurisdiction to be invalid or unenforceable such term or provision shall be deemed stricken and severed from this Agreement and any and all other terms of the
Agreement shall remain in full force and effect to the fullest extent permitted by law. The releases embodied in Paragraph&nbsp;4, 5 and 6 are the essence of this Agreement and should any of these
paragraphs be deemed invalid or unenforceable, this Agreement may be declared null and void and any consideration received under this Agreement shall be returned to GUESS. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
parties hereto acknowledge and agree that this Agreement constitutes and contains the entire agreement and understanding concerning the subject matter between the
parties and supersedes and replaces all prior negotiations and proposed agreements, whether written or oral, other than the Confidentiality Agreement and Sections&nbsp;7(b) through (e)&nbsp;of the
Employment Agreement. Each of the parties warrants that no other party or any agent or attorney or any other party has made any promise, representation or warranty whatsoever not contained herein to
induce each party to execute this Agreement and the other documents referred to herein. Each of the parties represents that they have not executed this Agreement or the other documents referred to
herein in reliance on any promise, representation or warranty not contained herein. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
parties hereto acknowledge and agree that the language of this Agreement shall be construed as a whole according to its fair meaning and not strictly for or against
any of the parties. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This
Agreement shall, in all respects, be interpreted, construed and governed by and under the domestic laws of the State of California. Any judicial proceeding brought
to interpret or enforce this Agreement shall be brought in the County of Los Angeles, State of California. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>3</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=3,EFW="2183334",CP="GUESS ?, INC.",DN="6",CHK=562177,FOLIO='3',FILE='DISK112:[08ZAF2.08ZAF48502]KM48502A.;5',USER='LSMITH',CD='29-MAR-2008;13:29' -->
<A NAME="page_km48502_1_4"> </A>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;11.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any
dispute or controversy arising under or in connection with this Agreement shall be settled exclusively by arbitration in Los Angeles, California, in accordance with
the Rules Resolution of Employment Disputes of the American Arbitration Association then in effect. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;12.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Should
any action be brought to enforce any of the terms or conditions of this Agreement, the prevailing party shall be entitled to recover all costs and expenses
incurred in the prosecution or defense of this action, including attorneys' fees. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;13.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;EMPLOYEE
acknowledges that EMPLOYEE has carefully read and fully understands this Agreement, and that EMPLOYEE has had the opportunity to ask GUESS about any questions,
concerns or issues in connection with this Agreement, or its terms. EMPLOYEE further acknowledges that EMPLOYEE has had the opportunity, and taken it to the extent EMPLOYEE deemed appropriate and
necessary, to consult legal counsel of EMPLOYEE's choice, in connection with this Agreement and consents to all of the terms and provisions contained herein knowingly, voluntarily and without any
reservation whatsoever. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;14.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Either
facsimile or original signatures shall be binding. EMPLOYEE's signature is binding when received by GUESS. </FONT></P>
